doc.field: This series contains websites and projects related to Deep Dish TV.

Waves of Change: The Many Voices of the Global Village is a multimedia project by Deep Dish Network designed to survey community media around the world by compiling and archiving the creative use of participatory communication globally. Waves of Change acts as a platform to share pieces that do not get seen outside of local coverage. The website includes an interactive map individual projects from their location on a world map and other media. Uprooted was a multiplatform (web, tv, dvd) media tool for activists and organizers advocating for migrant rights. The website contains a blog, news and events, and project videos.

We Interrupt this Program was a video/web series with Paper Tiger Television on the global eco-economic-political crises and rise in far-right politics. The series also includes a catalogue of all of their programs and associated video, as well as news, events, and other projects.

In 2020, the Deep Dish TV website was revived and ransitioned from a non-profit organization producing and distributing progressive video to an archival swebite that contains over 500 hours of programming. The series also contains the older version of the Deep Dish TV website with video and descriptions.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored with the permission of the content owner.
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of deepdishtv.org/ in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
